name: Frontend Code Quality
description: Evaluation rubric for frontend code (React, TypeScript, Next.js)

criteria.name: Correctness
criteria.description: Component logic, state management, event handling

levels.10: Perfect logic, comprehensive state management, all edge cases handled
levels.8-9: Correct logic, good state management, most cases handled
levels.6-7: Mostly correct, basic state management, some issues
levels.4-5: Logic errors, poor state management, many bugs
levels.1-3: Broken logic, no state management, unusable

examples.excellent: useEffect cleanup functions, proper error boundaries, optimistic updates
examples.poor: Memory leaks, missing error handling, state mutations

levels.10: WCAG 2.1 AA compliant, fully responsive, excellent UX

examples.excellent: Semantic HTML, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, mobile-first design
examples.poor: Divs everywhere, no alt text, fixed widths, no keyboard support

levels.10: Perfect ESLint compliance, strict TypeScript, well-structured
levels.8-9: Minor linting issues, good TypeScript usage
levels.6-7: Several linting issues, some any types
levels.4-5: Major violations, heavy use of any

examples.excellent: No ESLint warnings, strict mode, proper component composition
examples.poor: ESLint disabled, any everywhere, flat component structure

criteria.name: Performance
criteria.description: Render optimization, bundle size, lazy loading

levels.10: Optimal rendering, small bundles, comprehensive lazy loading
levels.8-9: Good optimization, reasonable bundles, some lazy loading
levels.4-5: Poor optimization, large bundles, no lazy loading
levels.1-3: No optimization, massive bundles, slow rendering

examples.excellent: React.memo, code splitting, dynamic imports, Web Vitals optimized
examples.poor: Re-renders entire app on state change, 5MB bundle, no code splitting
